meanings.definition: The state or quality of being excessively viscous.
meanings.sent1: The hyperviscosities of the syrup made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent2: The hyperviscosities of the oil caused the engine to overheat.
meanings.sent3: The hyperviscosities of the slime made it a challenge to clean up.
meanings.sent4: The hyperviscosities of the glue held the pieces together tightly.
meanings.sent5: The hyperviscosities of the mud made walking through it like wading through molasses.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by abnormally high viscosity levels in a fluid.
meanings.sent1: Doctors diagnosed the patient with hyperviscosities in their blood.
meanings.sent2: The hyperviscosities in the syrup caused it to stick to the spoon.
meanings.sent3: The hyperviscosities in the honey made it challenging to spread on toast.
meanings.sent4: The hyperviscosities in the lava slowed down its flow.
meanings.sent5: The hyperviscosities in the paint made it hard to apply smoothly.

meanings.definition: The presence of thick or sticky substances in a fluid.
meanings.sent1: The hyperviscosities in the mixture caused it to clump together.
meanings.sent2: The hyperviscosities in the gel made it difficult to wash off.
meanings.sent3: The hyperviscosities in the sauce made it hard to pour.
meanings.sent4: The hyperviscosities in the solution clogged the pipes.
meanings.sent5: The hyperviscosities in the slime made it fun to play with.
